text: [APPLAUSE]

It was October of my
first year as a teacher,
and I was struggling.
I was overwhelmed.

And doubting my
ability to teach.

In fact, one morning, I was at
breakfast at IHOP with my mom,

and I literally remember
crying into my pancakes.

Too many of our early career
teachers burn out and quit.

Of the 200,000 new teachers that
enter our classrooms each year,

48,000 don't return
for a second year.

Now, this is an enormous
problem for both our students
and our districts.

Each teacher that leaves,
costs our districts $21,000.

We-- New Teachers
Thriving-- envision a world

where all early career
teachers have access

to the social-emotional
supports to be
able to thrive as human beings.

And do outstanding work
with their students.

We pursue this vision
by offering teachers

a personal development
program, rooted in the latest
psychological evidence.

And we have the team that
can make this happen.

I have experience
as a researcher.

Crystel led a teacher
retention program
for all of New York City.

And Tyler spent five
years supporting hundreds
of early career teachers.

And we're already
seeing results.

84% of the teachers in our pilot
program agreed that taking part

made them more likely to stay
in the teaching profession.

With your support,
we can make sure

that teachers aren't
crying into their pancakes.

But instead, are thriving
in this most important
of professions.
Thank you.
[APPLAUSE]
